title: Using KernelShap with Pytorch
body:
I am trying to use KernelShap with Pytorch and I am getting an error when using it that says: 

```AssertionError: Unknown type passed as data object: <class 'torch.Tensor'>```

Here is the model and predict function: 

```py
import re
from torchtext.data.utils import ngrams_iterator
from torchtext.data.utils import get_tokenizer

ag_news_label = {1 : "World",
                 2 : "Sports",
                 3 : "Business",
                 4 : "Sci/Tec"}

def predict(text):
    ngrams=2
    with torch.no_grad():
       
        output = model(text, torch.tensor([0]))
        return output.argmax(1).item() + 1

model_2 = model_2.to("cpu")
```

And this is what I am using KernelShap for: 

```
tokenizer = get_tokenizer("basic_english")
ngrams = 2

text_example = 'I am Amir'
text_vector = torch.tensor([train_vocab[token] for token in ngrams_iterator(tokenizer(text_example), ngrams)])
explainer = shap.KernelExplainer(predict, torch.zeros(5))
```

Note that the size of text_vector in this case is [5] and I am just passing the median as zero. I actually am copying your tutorial on Keras where you passed zeros as median: [https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/master/notebooks/kernel_explainer/ImageNet%20VGG16%20Model%20with%20Keras.ipynb]()

Any help would be appreciated!
